item.ptxt: This fault may appear if the wiring harness has been damaged.
Follow the procedure described in Electrical Circuit Inspection Procedure .
This check enables the condition and the conformity of the engine wiring harness to be checked.
Conditions for applying the fault finding procedure to stored faults:
The fault is declared present after a series of full load/no load actions on the accelerator pedal.
Turbocharging, passenger compartment heating resistor activation and cruise control/ speed limiter are not authorized.
If the fault is present, the Injection warning light (gravity 1 warning light) is lit.
The engine speed is fixed at 1400 rpm if there is a fault on “main” and “sub” wire of the accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor and the engine torque is limited.
Use service wire for all operations on the controller connectors.
Priorities when dealing with a number of faults:
Apply the procedure for dealing with fault DTC P0651: Sensor Reference Voltage 2 Circuit:F9Q first if it is present or stored.

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: For wiring circuit and connector number, refer to A-5 Engine and A/C Control System Circuit Diagram (Diesel Model) .

entry.ptxt: Open circuit or short circuit to vehicle body ground
Inconsistency between APP sensor (main) and APP sensor (sub)

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CO0: Open circuit or short circuit to vehicle body ground

attention3.ptxt: Priorities when dealing with a number of faults:
If fault DTC P0225: APP Sensor (Main) Circuit:F9Q is present at the same time, check that the sensor is connected correctly.

entry.ptxt: Check the connections of the accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor.
Check the continuity and insulation from vehicle body ground of the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “E68-6” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-21” terminal of ECM connector
Between “E68-1” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-15” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: Measure the resistance on the accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor (sub) on accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly between “E68-1” and “E68-5” terminals.
Replace the accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly if the resistance is not 0.8 – 4.9 kΩ.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CC1: Short circuit to +12 V

attention3.ptxt: Priorities when dealing with a number of faults:
If fault DTC P0225: APP Sensor (Main) Circuit:F9Q is present at the same time, check that the sensor is connected correctly.

entry.ptxt: Check the connections of the accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor.
Check the continuity and insulation in relation to +12 V of the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “E68-6” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-21” terminal of ECM connector
Between “E68-1” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-15” terminal of ECM connector
Between “E68-5” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-27” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: Measure the resistance on the accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor (sub) on accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly between “E68-1” and “E68-5” terminals.
Replace the accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly if its resistance is not approximately: 0.8 – 4.9 kΩ.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for D1: Inconsistency between APP sensor (main) and APP sensor (sub)

entry.ptxt: Check the following connections for continuity and make sure there is no interference resistance:

item.ptxt: Between “E68-6” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-21” terminal of ECM connector
Between “E68-1” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-15” terminal of ECM connector
Between “E68-5” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-27” terminal of ECM connector
Between “E68-3” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-3” terminal of ECM connector
Between “E68-2” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-4” terminal of ECM connector
Between “E68-4” wire of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor connector and “E66-5” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly.
